result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L. Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher L. Lewis was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Get Drivers Licence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 2 are dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  Expunction hearing set for 2/17/17 at 8:30am.
